definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: There was silence as the elegant stomach specialist stood up.
sentences.chinese: 那位温文儒雅的胃病专家起立时室内一片寂静。

sentences.english: And whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace.
sentences.chinese: 凡不俯伏敬拜的，必立时扔在烈火的窑中。

sentences.english: During the winter, the spray from the falls immediately turns into icy pearls.
sentences.chinese: 冬日里，瀑布的飞沫立时变成了结冰的珍珠。

sentences.english: The market is declining! we recommend your immedidined contentment.
sentences.chinese: 市场在萎缩，我们创议你方立时接受。

sentences.english: Pleottom quote us when you receive our inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 请接到我们的询价单后立时给我们报价。

sentences.english: Therefore, the face of the Chinese conveyed professional humility.
sentences.chinese: 于是中国人的脸上立时堆满了专业的谦虚。

sentences.english: He was standing next to a guy who got hit by shrapnel and was immediately killed.
sentences.chinese: 他身边的一个人被楼上掉下的碎片击中，立时殒命。

sentences.english: Their hands held tight my arm while signing, thought a break open by force.
sentences.chinese: 他们双手立时抓住我的手臂，想一把扭开。

sentences.english: Oddly open, but is sign stunned speechless.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪地打开，却是立时怔住。

sentences.english: 72Immediately the rooster crowed the second time.
Immediately the rooster crowed the second time.
On hearing the whistle, Black Rose immediately turned around and started to retrace the route.
sentences.chinese: 黑玫瑰听得啸声，立时掉头，从来路奔了回去。

sentences.english: And the second time the cock crew.
Immediately therefore I sent to thee; and thou hast well done that thou art come.
sentences.chinese: 所以我立时打发人去请你，你来了很好。

sentences.english: I lunged at him then, my fingers curled into claws.
sentences.chinese: 我立时冲向他，五指弯成了爪子。

definition: in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
